cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles west of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico, then curving northwest and west-northwest toward the Louisiana coast and eventually into east Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast of Louisiana (roughly Intracoastal City–New Orleans corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, Lake Borgne, and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings in effect for Texas; hurricane watch begins east of Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Sabine Pass TX through Louisiana to the AL/FL border
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (forecast 2–4 ft for Sabine Pass area)
weather_observation.wind: Potential for tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 mph, gusts higher) with a 28 % chance of 34-kt winds and a 7 % chance of 50-kt winds at the port late Monday night through Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along Sabine Pass and adjacent Port Arthur waterways beginning late Monday
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated amounts near 5 inches Tuesday–Wednesday, creating flash-flood risk in low-lying terminals
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal flooding of access roads, possible power outages, and operational delays due to heavy rain bands and reduced visibility
